poem:
Title: "Of Cyber Tales and Peculiar Trails"

A restless moth, our Freund,
In digital's cold night.
Betwixt the wires' hum he leaned,
Hunting the light's offbeat bite.
An engineer in the vast, fast vast, 
His fingers swift on keys clasped,
Found malice in the echo's blast, 
For XZ Utils by evil was grasped. 
Such is the dirge technology has casked.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "One engineer’s curiosity may have saved us from a devastating cyber-attack | John Naughton On Good Friday, a Microsoft engineer named Andres Freund noticed something peculiar. He was using a software tool called SSH for securely logging into remote computers on the internet, but the interactions with the distant machines were significantly slower than usual. So he did some digging and found malicious code embedded in a software package called XZ Utils that was running". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: One engineer’s curiosity may have saved us from a devastating cyber-attack | John Naughton On Good Friday, a Microsoft engineer named Andres Freund noticed something peculiar. He was using a software tool called SSH for securely logging into remote computers on the internet, but the interactions with the distant machines were significantly slower than usual. So he did some digging and found malicious code embedded in a software package called XZ Utils that was running
